Recipe.Description: Tender chunks of beef, with carrots and potatoes in a thick beefy broth.

Ingredient.Name: Bacon fat
Ingredient.Notes: For searing meat and making roux.

Ingredient.Name: AP flour
Ingredient.Notes: For dredging meat and making roux.

Method.Step: Season the meat with salt in pepper, then dredge in flour. What you want is a really light dusting flour, not a breaded coating.
Melt bacon fat and continue heating until it begins to smoke, add the meat and sauté quickly until it is just well browned -you aren't trying to cook it thoroughly at this point.
Transfer meat to a large stock pot. Add stock. You could use canned broth, but ... and if you do I'd add a can of canned beef consommé. Add water, bay leaves and red pepper flakes and set to boil.
Meanwhile, peel and dice onions, add to pot. Trim and slice celery, add to pot. Peel and slice carrots, add to pot. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 1-2 hours.
Peel and quarter potatoes, add to pot. Add rosemary. Simmer until potatoes are fork-tender, probably another 20 minutes.
The starches from the flour and potatoes should have thickened the liquid by now. If you want it thicker, add a little Brown Roux until you get the right consistency.
Adjust the seasoning, serve with Buttermilk Biscuits.
